message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study utilizes household survey data from the LSMS-ISA database to analyze poverty levels among different demographic groups in East Asia and Pacific region.", "dataset": ["LSMS-ISA"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "In this research, we use time-series data from the World Development Indicators (WDI) and the Climate Research Unit (CRU) to analyze the relationship between extreme weather events and economic growth.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators (WDI)", "Climate Research Unit (CRU)"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed data on over 10,000 firms in East Asian countries from the Enterprise Survey conducted by the World Bank Group with additional data on product and input tariffs from the TRAINS database.", "dataset": ["Enterprise Survey", "TRAINS"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "To examine how energy access affects educational outcomes in Sub-Saharan Africa, we use household survey data from the DHS and information on electrification projects from the ESMAP Geospatial Database.", "dataset": ["DHS", "ESMAP Geospatial Database"], "topic": ["Education", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using official statistics on government revenue and expenditure from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) database and a dataset of fiscal decentralization measures developed by the World Bank, we investigate the impact of fiscal transfers on regional disparities in a federal country.", "dataset": ["International Monetary Fund (IMF)", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Governance", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We combine three datasets: the Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery (GFDRR) disaster risk profile, the World Bank's Public Expenditure Tracking Survey, and the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) to analyze the effectiveness of disaster management policies in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery (GFDRR)", "Public Expenditure Tracking Survey", "DHS"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Governance", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This research contributes to an emerging literature on China's Belt and Road Initiative by using a dynamic panel data model that incorporates data on infrastructure projects from the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) database, export and import statistics from the United Nations Comtrade Database, and macroeconomic indicators from the World Bank Development Indicators.", "dataset": ["Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS)", "United Nations Comtrade Database", "World Bank Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Regional Integration", "Macroeconomics", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the relationship between natural resource extraction and deforestation rates in Southeast Asia, we use spatial data from the Rainforest Foundation Norway and the Global Forest Watch platform as well as oil, gas and mineral extraction records from the Resource Governance Index (RGI) dataset.", "dataset": ["Rainforest Foundation Norway", "Global Forest Watch", "Resource Governance Index (RGI)"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Environment", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We draw upon two datasets: the Worldwide Governance Indicators (WGI) and the Living Standards Measurement Study Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) to evaluate the impact of agricultural extension services on governance quality and agricultural productivity in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Worldwide Governance Indicators (WGI)", "Living Standards Measurement Study Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we utilize household expenditure data from the National Sample Survey (NSS) and manufacturing census data from the Annual Survey of Industries (ASI) to understand the linkages between informal labor markets, household consumption, and small-scale manufacturing in India.", "dataset": ["National Sample Survey (NSS)", "Annual Survey of Industries (ASI)"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]} ]
